paper.title: Perceived Risk and Behavioral Intention of Customers Using Bayesian Technique
paper.abstract: In recent decades, the Internet has seen significant development, transforming into an expansive worldwide marketplace facilitating the exchange of various commodities and services. Nevertheless, an increasing number of individuals engaging in online transactions has resulted in a multitude of concerns and challenges. Online customers face a wider range of risks in comparison to those who participate in traditional shop purchasing experiences. The problem of customer perceptions of risk in the context of internet purchasing has emerged as a significant current concern. Thus, the current research used the Bayesian linear regression methodology to investigate the influence of perceived risk on consumers' behavioral intention within the realm of online purchasing. The findings of the research indicate the existence of four distinct categories of perceived risk, namely product risk, financial risk, convenience risk, and non-delivery risk. These risks are evaluated negatively by customers and have a significant impact on their behavioral intention while participating in online purchase activities.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究消费者在在线购物中的感知风险及其对行为意图的影响，虽然涉及金融风险的概念，但并未直接应用于衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等特定金融领域。
